text: Ricardo Moreno Escamilla (born February 7, 1937 in Chalchihuites, Zacatecas, Mexico, deceased June 25, 2008) was a Mexican professional boxer in the Super Featherweight division. Moreno was ranked #76 on The Ring's list of 100 All time Greatest Punchers.http://www.ibroresearch.com/?p=1323 ==Early life== Moreno was born and raised in the mining town of Chalchihuites, Zacatecas, Mexico. He left school to work as a metal breaker at the mines. Later he went to Mexico City where he worked as a parking lot attendant before turning to boxing. He did not fight as an amateur and turned professional at age 17 on June 16, 1954.http://boxrec.com/show_display.php?show_id=2373 ==Professional career== Known as "Pajarito", Moreno was a heavy puncher, having won 19 of his first 20 fights with all 19 of his wins by KO.http://www.notifight.com/artman2/publish/Reporte_7/Chucho_Cuate_recuerda_al_Pajarito_Moreno.php ===World Featherweight Title=== His only shot at a World Championship was on April 1, 1958 Moreno fought the champion Hogan Bassey in Wrigley Field, Los Angeles, California.http://boxrec.com/show_display.php?show_id=25500 Ricardo would lose this fight and it would also be Moreno's only shot at a world title due in large part to boxing politics.http://digitallibrary.usc.edu/search/controller/view/examiner-m14109.htmlhttp://www.boxeomundial.net/boxeo.php?category=noticias&id;=8897 After suffering two consecutive defeats in 1967, the 30-year-old Moreno retired. His only victory that wasn't a knockout was a disqualification victory.http://colectivomacheteenmano.blogspot.com/2010/01/un-idolo-del-boxeo- mexicano- ricardo.htmlhttp://www.deporteshoy.com/Biografia%20del%20Pajarito%20Moreno.html Due to his incredible knockout power, Moreno was named to the Ring Magazine's list of 100 Greatest Punchers.http://boxrec.com/media/index.php/Ricardo_Moreno ===Professional record=== |- style="margin:0.5em auto; He was duped by movie star weasels, his wealth was stolen, eventually he died a depressed man at the age of 71 at a Rehabilitation Center in Durango.http://www.boxingnews24.com/2010/04/boxing- musings-dirrell-and-valero/ He is buried in his home town of Chalchihuites in El Panteón Dolores.http://www.elsiglodedurango.com.mx/noticia/172517.ricardo- el-pajarito-moreno-emprendio-su-ultim.html ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Boxers from Zacatecas Category:People from Zacatecas City Category:Super-featherweight boxers Category:1937 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Mexican male boxers
